page.title: 09GRIBBEN HEAD INTERVIEW
page.content: {Gribbin Head-Interview} {______________________ { }One man told us how he had worked on the estate as a lad and he gave us this information :- At that time all the woods had big {timber trees}in, especially Corsican Pine.There was a herd of{10 wild goats out on the point.The cliffs were covered with{sea bird nests}of all kinds including{puffins.Egg collection during{the War}ended this.Another cause may also have been the increase of human activity due to the {shipbuilding at Par}and the shooting range on{Blackhead Point}opposite.The local Hunt always began their day's hunting at the Beacon as there was often a{family of foxes}in the wood.He said they hardly saw anyone except the odd visitor now and again.
